Module MathUtils
Package mathUtils.linear

Class Matrix

java.lang.Object
mathUtils.linear.Matrix
public class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents matrices from linear algebra. It is possible to perform matrix multiplication, find the determinant of the matrix, invert it and other useful functions. If a mathematically wrong action is performed, then an exception mathUtils.linear.Matrix.MatrixException is thrown. Note that only numbers may be accepted in the matrix and no variables within the foreseeable time, but you may achieve a similar result by using variables inside of custom methods. Matrices stand in form of an array of arrays, commonly known as a 2D-Array. This class is intended to be used in a functional manner; It is intended to be versatile and may therefore slow down the program due to heavy object creation. For example, a matrix:

\( \begin{bmatrix} x_{11} & x_{12} & x_{13}\\ x_{21} & x_{22} & x_{23}\\ x_{31} & x_{32} & x_{33} \end{bmatrix} \)

Can be created with:

Matrix m = new Matrix(new double[][] {
    { x[0][0], x[0][1], x[0][2] },
    { x[1][0], x[1][1], x[1][2] },
    { x[2][0], x[2][1], x[2][2] },
};

Elements of a matrix can be set like this:
m.put(value, column, row);

And they can be retrieved like this:
m.get(column, row);

NOTE Matrix indices start with 0, not with 1.
Since:
19.05.2020

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Matrix.MatrixException
    This class represents an exception that is thrown when mathematically illegal calculations are performed with matrices.

      The default constructor. The matrix holds no value.

    • Matrix

      public Matrix​(int columns, int rows)
      Constructs a matrix with the given dimensions. All elements of the matrix are set to 0.
      Parameters:
      columns - The number of columns
      rows - The number of rows

  • Method Details

    • rotationX

      public static Matrix rotationX​(double alpha)
      This method creates a matrix using its parameter to create the matrix used to rotate a point around the x-Axis. Multiply this matrix by a point to rotate it. The matrix described by:

      \( R_x(\alpha) = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0\\ 0 & \cos \alpha & -\sin \alpha \\ 0 & \sin \alpha & \cos \alpha \end{bmatrix} \)
      Parameters:
      alpha - The rotation around the x-Axis in degrees
      Returns:
      The matrix holding the values in double precision for the desired rotation

    • rotationY

      public static Matrix rotationY​(double beta)
      This method creates a matrix using its parameter to create the matrix used to rotate a point around the y-Axis. Multiply this matrix by a point to rotate it. The matrix is described by:

      \( R_y(\beta) = \begin{bmatrix} \cos \beta & 0 & \sin \beta\\ 0 & 1 & 0 \\ -\sin \beta & 0 & \cos \beta \end{bmatrix} \)
      Parameters:
      beta - The rotation around the y-Axis in degrees
      Returns:
      The matrix holding the values in double precision for the desired rotation

    • rotationZ

      public static Matrix rotationZ​(double gamma)
      This method creates a matrix using its parameter to create the matrix used to rotate a point around the z-Axis. Multiply this matrix by a point to rotate it. The matrix is described by:

      \( R_z(\gamma) = \begin{bmatrix} \cos \gamma & -\sin \gamma & 0\\ \sin \gamma & \cos \gamma & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix} \)
      Parameters:
      gamma - The rotation around the z-Axis in degrees
      Returns:
      The matrix holding the values in double precision for the desired rotation

    • rotationXYZ

      public static Matrix rotationXYZ​(double alpha, double beta, double gamma)
      This method creates a matrix using its parameters to create the matrix used to rotate a point around the x-, y- , and z-Axis. Multiply this matrix by a point to rotate it. The matrix is described by:

      \( R(\alpha, \beta, \gamma) = R_z(\gamma) \cdot R_y(\beta) \cdot R_x(\alpha) = \begin{bmatrix} \cos \gamma & -\sin \gamma & 0\\ \sin \gamma & \cos \gamma & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} \cos \beta & 0 & \sin \beta\\ 0 & 1 & 0 \\ -\sin \beta & 0 & \cos \beta \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0\\ 0 & \cos \alpha & -\sin \alpha \\ 0 & \sin \alpha & \cos \alpha \end{bmatrix} \)
      Parameters:
      alpha - The rotation around the x-Axis in degrees
      beta - The rotation around the y-Axis in degrees
      gamma - The rotation around the z-Axis in degrees
      Returns:
      The matrix holding the values in double precision for the desired rotation

    • scale

      public static Matrix scale​(double sx, double sy, double sz)
      This method returns the matrix used to scale a point around the origin. It works in a similar fashion the rotation matrix does:

      \( S(s_x, s_y, s_z) = \begin{bmatrix} s_x & 0 & 0\\ 0 & s_y & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & s_z \end{bmatrix} \)
      Parameters:
      sx - Scalar along the x-Axis
      sy - Scalar along the y-Axis
      sz - Scalar along the z-Axis
      Returns:
      The scaling matrix with the desired values in double precision

      Returns:
      The 2D-Array

    • setColumn

      public Matrix setColumn​(int n, double[] col) throws Matrix.MatrixException
      This method takes an array of doubles as its argument and replaces the given column with the new one.
      Parameters:
      n - Row of column to be replaced
      col - Actual column as an array
      Returns:
      The updated matrix
      Throws:
      Matrix.MatrixException - If column has wrong dimensions

      The updated matrix

    • toPoint

      public Point toPoint() throws Matrix.MatrixException
      Converts this matrix to an instance of mathUtils.linear.Point:

      \( \begin{bmatrix} x\\ y\\ z \end{bmatrix} = P(x, y, z) \)
      Returns:
      The Point
      Throws:
      Matrix.MatrixException - If Matrix is not a 3x1 matrix

    • isSquare

      public boolean isSquare()
      Checks if this matrix is a square matrix (a matrix having as many rows as columns).
      Returns:
      The result

    • isSingular

      public boolean isSingular()
      Checks if this matrix is singular (a matrix having a determinant of 0). Note that this method has a computation time of O(n!) if it is square.
      Returns:
      The result

    • product

      public Matrix product​(Matrix m) throws Matrix.MatrixException
      Multiplies this matrix with given matrix (in that order, as matrices are not commutative). The result is a matrix with the following dimensions: [this.columns, matrix.rows]
      Parameters:
      m - The Matrix to multiply by
      Returns:
      The updated matrix
      Throws:
      Matrix.MatrixException - If number of rows of this matrix is not equal to number of columns of given matrix

      Returns:

    • addColumn

      public Matrix addColumn​(int n, double[] col) throws Matrix.MatrixException
      Inserts a column in the desired row. All columns that come thereafter are pushed one index to the right. If index is greater than or equal to the number of columns, then the column is appended as last column of the matrix. If column is smaller than or equal to 0, then it becomes the first column of the matrix.
      Parameters:
      n - Index of row
      col - The column
      Returns:
      The The updated matrix
      Throws:
      Matrix.MatrixException - If column has incorrect dimensions

    • addRow

      public Matrix addRow​(int n, double[] col) throws Matrix.MatrixException
      Inserts a row in the desired column. All rows that come thereafter are pushed one index to the bottom. If index is greater than or equal to the number of rows, then the column is appended as last row of the matrix. If row is smaller than or equal to 0, then it becomes the first row of the matrix.
      Parameters:
      n - Index of column
      col - The row
      Returns:
      The The updated matrix
      Throws:
      Matrix.MatrixException - If row has incorrect dimensions

    • deleteColumn

      public Matrix deleteColumn​(int n)

      Parameters:
      n - The row
      Returns:
      The updated matrix

      Returns:
      The updated matrix
      Throws:

    • matrixOfMinors

      public Matrix matrixOfMinors() throws Matrix.MatrixException
      Determines the matrix of minors of this matrix (replaces all elements with their minor matrix's determinant).
      Returns:
      The matrix of minors
      Throws:
      Matrix.MatrixException - If matrix is not square

    • matrixOfCofactors

      public Matrix matrixOfCofactors()
      Determines this matrix's cofactors (every second element is multiplied with -1).
      Returns:
      The matrix of cofactors

    • identityMatrix

      public Matrix identityMatrix() throws Matrix.MatrixException
      Determines this matrix's identity (a matrix with only zeroes, but a diagonal line of ones, from up-left to right-down).
      Returns:
      The identity matrix
      Throws:
      Matrix.MatrixException - If matrix is not square

    • determinant

      public double determinant() throws Matrix.MatrixException
      Determines this matrix's determinant. Note that this method has a computation time of O(n!).
      Returns:
      The determinant
      Throws:
      Matrix.MatrixException - If matrix is not square

      Returns:
      Updated matrix
      Throws:
      Matrix.MatrixException - If power is negative and matrix is singular or not square
